channel.title: Comments on: Revisiting: Searching JavaScript arrays with a binary search
channel.description: On programming and text editing. Addicted to lisps.

item.title: By: broken64
item.dc:creator: broken64
item.description: The array needs to be sorted in order for binarySearch to work properly
item.content:encoded: The array needs to be sorted in order for binarySearch to work properly

item.title: By: Å tÄ›pÃ¡n Kouba
item.dc:creator: Å tÄ›pÃ¡n Kouba
item.description:
Thanks for the article!
Array.prototype.sort uses Unicode code by default (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/sort). I believe that every JS developer slammed his face into his desk when using this method. :-)
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for the article!

Array.prototype.sort uses Unicode code by default (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/sort). I believe that every JS developer slammed his face into his desk when using this method. ðŸ™‚
